title: Tip for iiNet users
body:
Hello Everyone,

I spent the past 1.5 hours on the phone with tech support, troubleshooting my connection, and making sure I was getting the best possible connection. I recently moved, and since then, I have had "ok" internet connectivity. I was averaging around 4mbs download, and .3mbs up. After restarting my modem, upgrading the firmware, verifying all my settings were correct and resetting my connection to the exchange. I found connection profile in my "toolbox" online. I was set at Standard, but there is a setting for "Thrillseeker" and "Gamer" as well. 

After changing my profile to Thrillseeker, I know get 7mbs down. I know this isn't great, but every mb helps and wanted to share this with anyone else that may benefit.

**TL;DR - changing my iiNet connection profile (within the online toolbox) from "Standard" to "Thrillseeker" increased my download speed from 4mbs to 7mbs...woot.**

Best,
Riot Cochese

replies.body:
>7mbs down

Meanwhile I get 500kbps.

thank you telstra.

Lol u think thats bad...
Im just out of range of one of those internet towers or something
i get a SOLID 250kb/s - 300kb/s
it used to be about 80kb/s but we got some stuff sorted out
wouldn't it be nice if we all had fibreeeeee (in tune of cadbury song)

Watch out for the occasional "speed bump". My modem used to restart on it's own where the speed would stay at 1mbps for a few days, and then restart itself again and be back to the usual 6.5. This happened so often that I rang support who put me back to standard and I haven't had the problem since. I'm happy with 5.5mbps and no speed bumps.
Optus is so shit atm... 200 kbs... fuck my life
I wish I had fiber. I am about 1km away from the nearest exchange, and don't understand why I can't get better speeds than I am seeing.

Just rub it in more mate, throw some salt in lemon in there to. I was living off 3G for 5 years, I finally got ADSL and then I realize it's damn near obsolete these days, RIP. In Fact my 3G had better speeds.

I get 22.6 mbs download...
but like 1.6 mbs upload so it balances really bad
